reviews.review_msg: I took BPK 140 ~3/4 years ago. I'm shocked there weren't more reviews, given how long it's been taught. Course was disorganized and poorly run. TA ignored rubrics and unfairly deducted marks for things that met the criteria (e.g., peer-reviewed sources from SFU library). Be extremely cautious!! Grading was inconsistent and frustrating throughout.

He's a nice professor and explains things well. I had to take this course twice because I didn't pass the first time, and between the two profs I've had for 305 Poburko is much better. This course is just tough.
He was very nice and lectures were interesting, but the midterms and the final were graded so unfairly. It was impossible to get a good grade in this course.

He's a good teacher and a nice guy BUT the midterms are terrible. They are in a 50min time block and paragraph response style. Not enough time to include the level of detail he wants and so you either answer the question in a general sense and do bad or you go into detail but run out of time/don't complete the questions A set up for failure :)
